info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 5:59PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Yuma County through 615 PM MDT... At 558 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wray, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Yuma County, including the following locations... Laird. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 239 and 253. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
